What we did Working principles

Hypotheses #2

We believe that if we provide people with guidance they need on how to manage risk in Co-op, in language and at a level they understand

We'll see people managing risk more successfully, feeling more confident and working more efficiently

We’ll know this is true when business partners recognise improved quality when they assess and assure teams, we receive positive feedback from co-ordinators from user testing, ad hoc comments and as part of a quarterly survey

Related hypotheses

#1, #4

Considerations

  • A need for the whole risk team to finalise the risk framework and all agree it
  • The most suitable location for it (intranet, internet, within a software system itself, paper, via F2F/ e-training)
  • It needs to be accessible at the point of need
  • Risk Colleagues may not need to use the whole framework directly, consider additional ways to make it meaningful
  • Real examples would help people
  • This should apply to all people who deal with risk, including ‘side of deskers’
  • It needs to be communicated clearly, using the language your users use
  • It needs to involve the user in the design to identify a consistent role set and description
  • Could users help provide examples and case studies, especially if it’s a living thing?
